Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
June 30 and July 6, 2022. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is
required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also
violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from
the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable correction action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the
following information prior to employment or at the time
specified in this rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior to
employment from persons unrelated to the employee and
which are less than 12 months old.
One of five new hire files reviewed had two of the three references completed after
the employee was hired.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not in need of consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. It was in result to a special investigation
that involved behavior management and a staff member not following the facility’s
Code of Conduct. The facility’s corrective action plan compliance is monitored
quarterly, and they have implemented each action step within their corrective action
plan.
4

Chief Administrator Assessment
The facility is working on defining the program within Leppien. There have been
some struggles to identify what the program is and working with the youth to help
them better understand the program. There are many new employees working at
Leppien and currently the house supervisor position is being filled by the Quality
Manager. The position is posted with the hopes of hiring someone soon. Many of the
youth have on-campus jobs and are working toward independent living. Overall, the
feeling is the facility is moving forward and getting to where the program needs to be.
Interviews
Youth reported in interviews that at times the house can be filled with “drama.” Youth
reported being involved in on campus jobs, going on outings off campus and overall
having their needs met. Youth reported understanding the rules, having regular
therapy and not having concerns with staff. Staff reported the house being “hectic”
due to some behaviors between some of the youth. Staff stated they feel the youths’
needs are being met. Staff reported feeling supported and having the tools needed to
complete their job successfully.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
